intro: Clinelymus, commonly known as the hardstem buckwheat, is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive seed pods and often edible leaves. Clinelymus species are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their rough, woody stems and alternate leaves. The flowers are small and clustered, often producing achenes as fruits.
